website_summaries.verdict: The type of spark screen to choose when you have a medium-size fire pit to cover for increased safety.
pros: Circular profile of the spark screen provides a tight seal around the edge of the fire pit
Prevents stray sparks from escaping between any small gaps
Features folding design with side handles
cons: Size of the spark screen limits its use to small fire pits no more than 27" in diameter

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT-- but Rusts
customer_reviews.text: Loved this .. A little pricey but works awesome to keep all those embers from flying around. and having the ability to lift up half at a time to roast marshmallows or add logs was awesome. super easy to put together. I would say well worth the price.. Only one downside it rusts.. I would suggest getting some rustoleum high heat spray as the coating that comes on it if rained on will rust. But painting is no big deal. we will paint it before we use it again this summer
customer_reviews.author: dani

customer_reviews.title: as others had recommended. It is looking as good as the first ...
customer_reviews.text: I did paint the cover with heat resisted flat black paint, as others had recommended. It is looking as good as the first day I used it. I also used Locktight on each of the screws to prevent the nuts from backing off. I am happy with it and have also purchased a vinyl cover to keep the rain out of the pit when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: 32" Screen works for 30" fire pit with 3" lip.
customer_reviews.text: Seems good enough to me. Yes, it will rust if you leave it outside, dew, rain, etc, duh. Easy to assemble, easy to open, seems sturdy enough. I bought the 32" for my 30" inside diameter pit with a 3" lip; it sits about 1" out on the lip, (see pictures.)
customer_reviews.author: Termitescout

customer_reviews.title: Holes burn through it! Not rust proof and sides don't line up well and jam
customer_reviews.text: Update: now the screen has holes in it! So I have a worthless piece of rusted metal!!! Within a week this item rusted and discolored. Others reviewed this and said they had no issues with rust, I guess I got the unlucky one. The shape is a little off. It is not round and there are gaps where the two halves of the screens line up. It's supposed to be 50". I measured my existing fire pit and when the cover arrived, I have to basically rebuild the fire pit to make it smaller for the screen to fit on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice screen
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with it, easy to assemble and sits just right on my homemade fire pit. It fits the way I wanted it to over the Sun Joe SJFP30-D Fire Joe 29.5" Fire Bowl that I bought. See photos. The mesh screen is actually heavier than I expected. I will paint it and the fire bowl with high temp paint before using.
customer_reviews.author: L. Witt

customer_reviews.title: Not as large as advertised but otherwise good
customer_reviews.text: This is overall a great screen for an outdoor fire pit. It seems sturdy and well made, and we like the fact that we can open and close it easily during use. However, we bought the 50" screen (which they seem to no longer offer as I write this review) and it is NOT as large as advertised. We found it to be 48" in diameter and although we are able to use it, it required some modifications to our fire pit. This may be why they aren't offering it now, but be aware that the size advertised may be larger than the actual measured size of the screen once you get it.
customer_reviews.author: Texas

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: This fire pit cover seemed great but the first time I used it (just to test moving the cover) one of the handles broke off (see picture). This makes it effectively useless. All Amazon offers is to return it. I'm not going to pay to ship such a large item so now i'm stuck with a product that is defective. Very unhappy with this purchase. How hard is it to properly weld on a handle?
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Haviland

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. My original fire pit has gone through several of these type of screens. The original mfr wants $60. Those stainless ones are nearly $200!! This one is much better with the 'quartered' design and all that framing. A cheap furniture cover will keep these screens going for 3-5 years (if you don't step on them in the dark).
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Screen fits our fire pit
customer_reviews.text: The screen fits well over our fire pit. Will see how this weathers the test of time and hopefully doesn't rust. It works great over our fire pit in our back yard so size dimensions were accurate. You have to be careful you don't burn yourself when using the handles to put up and down one of the sides to the screen. There is some assembly required, but not too complicated to setup. But nothing too fancy about this. Including a picture of the screen over our fire pit.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Stowell

customer_reviews.title: Burn the instructions, but keep the screen!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly: fairly straightforward if you take the poor instructions with a grain of salt. I had to set instructions aside and kinda piece the four quarters together unfastened to realize which was which lettered piece (no corresponding labels on the similar looking parts). Wasn’t impossible to figure out. Function: the one half easily raises and lowers to add wood and poke the fire. Keeps floating ambers retained. That’s a positive. However, the screen has warped in the ensuing heat, so not the appeasing curved dome. Looks like it’s dented, but it’s from the heat. Probably needed a thicker gage for screen material. All in all, it serves the intended purpose, so 4 of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Fire Pit screen for light duty
customer_reviews.text: Mechanically this screen looks good and it was relatively easy to assemble. It did come in 4 pieces and had to be bolted together. My primary issue with it is that the mesh is quite thin and will likely not last very long exposed to the hot fires in my fire pit. This is an update to my original rating. I have used the screen now for 12 months and as I suspected, the screen mesh is falling apart. It is definitely a light duty screen. I use mine for a fire pit where I periodically burn cut up limbs and logs from trees on my property.
customer_reviews.author: EPT

customer_reviews.title: Looks good.  But HEADSUP !
customer_reviews.text: Important: my metal fire pit (bought at home depot) measures 24" across, but the screen that came with it sits just inside that on some pegs. I didn't see this. So now that I've ordered this 24" screen, it's slightly too large. What I did was bolt the 2 pieces together so now it's 1 solid dome and I just rest it on the lip of the fire pit. works ok. Looks good. Next time I will order the one that came with the unit for $30 more.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Too complex FOUR piece assembly. BAD INSTRUCTIONS!
customer_reviews.text: The item I received WAS NOT whats pictured or described. It was SUPPOSED to be only 2 pieces with VERY LITTLE assembly. What I received was FOUR pieces and the instructions SUCK! I'm returning it because the instructions were SO BAD I cant even figure out how to assemble it. This was why I ordered the TWO PIECE product because I DONT WANT TO FIGURE OUT HOW TO ASSEMBLE IT!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Seeker

customer_reviews.title: For the price a great screen.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item in Spring of 2015 - after heavy usage and it sitting out in the weather for 2 years, it has come to the usable end of its life. Did not have any issues with the nuts as people have reported, but I did spray it with the high heat paint after year one and that seemed to work out well. Probably should have done that every 3-4 months. The mesh screen near the top (due to constant contact with flames) was the first thing to go - Will buy it again, .
customer_reviews.author: Doneeb

customer_reviews.title: Value item.
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting it to be so nice. I've been burning a lot since it arrived and not having to worry about a stray ember getting away. I like the way you can open either side and toss a log inside. Update! I used it for two years and finally the screen gave out. I really abused it with roaring fires, rain and snow. I figured out a way to replace the screen so every two years I only need to purchase a roll of 1/4 “ screen and replace it. If you treat it better than me I’m sure it would last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.

customer_reviews.title: Not the worst product I ever got. but can be a bit frightening
customer_reviews.text: It keeps sliding off the edge of the firepit. Then when I open one side, the side you are not moving, doubles back onto the one your trying to move.(I hope that makes sense) I wish it had some sort of stop blocking the swing so that it die not go 'round robin' on you with a live fire in the firepit. It catches you unawares and can be quite dangerous when it flips back in the way. It gets frighteningly uncontrollably.
customer_reviews.author: An observent customer

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: The measurements where way off. I had to buy nuts and bolt to secure one side. It said it fit 30”x31” inch bowels. It was way to big and could have fit a 35”-36” bowl. This ha been consisted with puschases and also on return papers. I’ll again before I order from Amazon again
customer_reviews.author: William H. Keeler

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I painted with Rustoleum to further protect it. So far has weathered both the fire pit and all the rain flawlessly.I have received many compliments on it's appearance and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: It fits my fire container and folds.
customer_reviews.text: It is already starting to rust. Not good for an outdoor item. The original folding screen lasted for 15 years. Took me several years to find a folding screen online; from a manufacture in my state. It rusted out with in 3 years. I was delighted to discover Amazon had folding fire screens, the size I needed, an affordable. As a Wiccan I do lots of fire ceremonies, so I need the protection of the screen outside. The only good thing about the screen frame starting to rust after just a few months, is that I now know I can get a new folding screen at Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the product but returned it for next size up . Purchased 28 but it was to small. I assembled because I measure diameter and 28 should have worked. I disassembled and repackaged after I saw it would not work. Very well made and sturdy especially for the price. Can't wait to get next size up so we can use it with our fire pit. I have small grandchildren and think this product will be ideal for use around them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: This product appears to be well made, a good value. I will need to apply a coat of heat resistant paid on it but this was anticipated. I gave this product a 4 star not because of the quality of the product, but because of very poor assembly instructions. I ended up bringing up the product description / picture on the Amazon Order site using the various image options to view a close up of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: looks nice but scews came out soon after using
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one. The first one rusted in one year. We took precautions with the second by spraying a high heat paint on before using. It is slightly rusted after the first year of use. We will spray again before using it next year. The screws on the hinge came out easily after a couple weeks of use. They should rework this as it seems to be a common issue.
customer_reviews.author: penny roth

customer_reviews.title: Great For Me
customer_reviews.text: Fits as good as I would expect. I am adding two screws on the side to stabilize the fixed side and anchor to the pit, Depending on your fit , you will need to consider the possibility of some retro fitting to stabilize it as I did, since it does have a hinge action. I have the tools and i am somewhat handy. It was no problem for me. I like the fact that it has a lift up hinged section. That was part of my plan. The old one was a low profile one piece.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Update: Don't Like this.
customer_reviews.text: Update: Now 3 years old. Now useless. The metal mesh has sagged creating mechanical interference to open and closing. When new: Perfect for what I needed on my fire pit. When not in use I made the mistake of throwing a pair of wet gloves on the dome to dry. This rusted the mesh where the gloves rested. Won't do that again. This was a learning indicating I shouldn't leave the dome out in raining weather either. I did buy high temp black paint and will paint seasonally to keep up dome appearance and store in a dry place for the fall/winter/spring weather.
customer_reviews.author: Mag

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: We bought this so that ashes and sparks wouldn’t fly up from the fire pit when Wood was burning. It unfortunately doesn’t stop any of the flying ashes because the openings are too big. Otherwise it’s well made and looks good and great if you are just looking for something to keep kids from trying to put their hands in.
customer_reviews.author: Holley

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant product... 🔥-pit must have!
customer_reviews.text: Very glad to have found this product! I was looking for a standard fire pit that you have to lift the lid. This is much simpler to use and the design provides access to both sides of the fire as needed. Time will tell regarding durability. But after a few months of use it still looks good.
customer_reviews.author: bswarmer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Serves its purpose. Not flimsy. It just wasn’t as easy to assemble as the picture looks. The screen comes in 4 pieces, tiny screws to build the halves which is a little tricky by yourself since it’s a half circle. Worth it since I could not find a screen in the stores around me and it was cheaper than the shelf price with delivery included :)
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations EDIT: for 10 months
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with design and material. Prior to assembly I treated this screen with clear high temp spray paint to ensure a long life. Great profile! UPDATE with HEARTBREAK: The screen is crumbles in 10 months counting 20 little tree-stick and junk mail aestetic one hour campfires (no bonfires). Dome form was great while the spark arrester lasted... crying.
customer_reviews.author: A Kern

customer_reviews.title: Well made.  Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This fire screen is perfect for our backyard fire pit. It has a nice height. It's sturdy. It seems the screen is fine enough to catch all the embers. We live near an open space and safe fires are very important to us. The screen will open from either side so it is easy to access the fire or to roast marshmallows. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nae Nae

customer_reviews.title: Great firepit cover!
customer_reviews.text: The handles do get hot - this is just common sense, so this alone would be the only negative comment. It was super easy to assemble, and looks great, too. We keep ours in an outdoor shed when not using to keep it beautiful longer and to keep it from rusting, which will happen if left out. Common sense, people!
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: Can't handle the heat.
customer_reviews.text: I have used the cover just 3 times and the metal has become warped and it will not open and close.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Easily Assembled
customer_reviews.text: Update: this is our second summer with this cover. It needs repainting as the screen has rusted and the two halves don't open well due to the screen bring bent out of shape. This went together really well. I sprayed it with that heat protecting paint that others had recommended. One thing to keep in mind is, as this heats up it bends a little and doesn't move back into position very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT! Just what we needed for our DIY fire pit. Our dog kept getting into the ash so we needed something to keep her out of it. Has been holding up well over the past few months. We bought it used on here and it came in like new condition. Was super easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe Childers

customer_reviews.title: BEST cover out there!
customer_reviews.text: We love this new fireplace cover! We have burned through so many covers because we do outside fires 2-4 times a week. This one is high enough to keep the flames from burning through it, and is heavy duty. The ability to open from the side to add wood & stir the fire is wonderful. We would buy this again
customer_reviews.author: M. Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Just ok is not ok....
customer_reviews.text: This thing has turned into a little bit of a disaster. I opening/closing mechanism doesn't function as well as it should and in my case the fact that it wasn't a perfect fit for my fire pit really created some issues. Unless the measurements of this are perfect for your fire pit, I would advise you go with a one piece spark shield.
customer_reviews.author: aaronwmu

customer_reviews.title: LOW QUALITY SCREEN
customer_reviews.text: Future Buyers Beware the metal screen is a very thin gauge. Mine arrived, bent and out of shape right out of the box. After constructing, one side scrapes against the other when opening. Also the thin screen will not withstand much heat without warping, and has already begun to rust, even though I keep it covered. Do not recommend this fire screen.
customer_reviews.author: oggie

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect on the outside fire pit on the deck. Now I can enjoy my scotch and cigars without having to keep an eye on the burning embers floating off from the dang firepit...I mean really, how many things can a man be expected to do at once?!? Besides, I only have two hands and they are busy holding my scotch and cigar!
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: Review posted...Reluctantly!
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Should have come with Lock Nuts. The nuts provided have to be re-tightened after and sometimes during use. I had a fall outting and was opening the unit often for little ones wanting to roast hot dogs and other treats. When closed some really fine embers were small enough to get thru. No major concerns. I highly suggest storing the unit in the garage, etc., when not in use. Note of Truth: I hate leaving reviews for everything I buy via Amazon.com. After constantly popping up on my app dozens of times, I reluctantly yielded and posted this review.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in missing parts but lid seems nice
customer_reviews.text: Just open the box and got it out to put together and it is missing some of the screws and whatnot that it lists that it's supposed to come with so we can't properly put it together to put it to the test so I guess I'll have to review it when I go out and get additional Parts which is incredibly disappointing
customer_reviews.author: heatherk

customer_reviews.title: Measure Your Fire Pit Diameter Twice Before Buying
customer_reviews.text: Great for the function. Little hard to assemble at first since it has a total of four sections to put together. Double check the size of your fire pit before purchasing this item. It was an inch too big to fit over the fire pit and too tall for the fire pit cover when you add up total height.
customer_reviews.author: Frederic

customer_reviews.title: Nice Screen
customer_reviews.text: Nice grate for my home-made fire pit. It does rust in the rain, but I re-painted it with a can of Rustoleum spray paint. I like that you can lift either side of the two-piece screen. But use caution, the handles do heat up.
customer_reviews.author: William L.

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT fit my 40" fire pit...
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, this does not fit the 40" copper fire pit that I ordered, depsite the listing suggesting that it would. It is about 1/2" too small and just slides down into the fire pit bowl so that it is never sitting evenly. Returning. Bummed. Seems to be good quality tho.
customer_reviews.author: mommag

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. We used it once before today and when we went to use it tonight one of the handles fell off. Of course the window to return the item ended yesterday. I do not recommend this product as it’s obviously poorly made for the handle to fall off during the second usage.
customer_reviews.author: Bellemontleo

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement
customer_reviews.text: It fit fine. Not exact as the original, but works just fine. People complain it rusts. Yeah . . . well . . . it is exposed to extreme heat then left outside in the rain. But the rust/wear are minimal, and the unit works just fine
customer_reviews.author: jay montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but not thrilled with it.
customer_reviews.text: This is very flimsy. It has huge gaps where the two halves fit together which let out a lot of embers. The metal mesh was bent upon arrival too, although it was not bad enough to warrant returning it. It will do for now until I can get a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Instant upgrade to a lift only lid
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the sturdiness and quality of this item. Easy to assemble and really gives my fire pit a bit space for wood burning and flip lid is safer than the lift only lid that came with my pit. Brilliantly done, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Informed Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Looks awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our lake house fire pit. My hubby and I assembled it together which may be why I gave it 4 stars. Maybe if I had done it myself I could have given 5 stars. :-). It looks great and I really like the sliding opening!
customer_reviews.author: Kwbrdh

customer_reviews.title: Fire pit screen
customer_reviews.text: The screen was a little hard to put together , but once I got it set up the right way it went right together easily. There are a few sharp edges, so you need to be careful of your fingers. It has a nice weight to it and opens easily from both sides.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Just beautiful :) Love it and it looks great. We decided to keep it indoors so it doesn't rust.
customer_reviews.text: Just beautiful :) Love it and it looks great. We decided to keep it indoors so it doesn't rust. Another person suggested to buy Rustoleum 2000* spray paint to touch up the rust in the future. 5 Stars from us:)
customer_reviews.author: Hummingbird Ranch Vacation House Rental

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble but require some type of lip to lay flat
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Have not had a fire yet, what would’ve been more helpful in the reviews is that it would work better if your fire pit has a lip. I have a 24 inch fire pit without a lip, so will need to do some fabricating to sort that out. It does not lay flat as of yet
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine M. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: it's just OK
customer_reviews.text: yeah it has already started to rust a bit and warped with heat. The paint just melts right off. I'll probably need a new one before i will have had this one a year. i wouldn't buy it again for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Have fire proof gloves and only let an adult handle the addition of wood or burning material.l
customer_reviews.text: Use it for my fire pit. The dimensions measure 32" however the cover's side that lifts is not quite 32". It is just short enough to be a bit precarious at times when opening the cover. Often the whole cover falls in or out. At this time I am looking a adding a piece to it for balance and a better fit. The next size up would have been too big.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn D.

customer_reviews.title: Works to stop fire ember’s okay but not that Heavy Duty for the price 😔
customer_reviews.text: Not as sturdy as I expected 😔 Say’s it is heavy duty - assembly instructions are not real clear . After a couple of fires in my fire pit the screen mesh warped and the paint burned off. Should be painted with high heat fire resistance paint
customer_reviews.author: JW Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Extend the life of your fire pit with this spark screen.
customer_reviews.text: I have a fire pit that is several years old. The spark screens rust out and need replacement. I was happy to find this particular model on Amazon and appreciated the comments in the reviews. I purchased high temp paint and spray painted it with a coat of black paint prior to using it to get more wear out of it before rusting. I also used three pieces of fencing ties to hold it securely in place on top of the fire pit so it doesn't slide around. I feel much safer using the fire pit with the spark screen on it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy D. Karl

customer_reviews.title: Works and looks great!
customer_reviews.text: We bought a spark screen several months ago to use at another location. We liked it so much we decided to buy another for home. This one is perfect and the price is excellent - love the look and quality!
customer_reviews.author: Bobs Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great design. Solid build.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t be happier with this heavy duty screen. Easy to assemble and really easy to use. Heavy duty construction. The hinged two-part design makes accessing the fire easy from either side without having to remove the screen completely. The high dome fits my cooking grate perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: P. M. Keene

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: The directions were a little confusing. I think my parts weren’t labeled correctly. But once I ditched the directions and just did what made sense, it was fine. Anyway, it’s a nice quality spark screen for the money. We have it on an outdoor fire pit that we built.
customer_reviews.author: L Howard

customer_reviews.title: A year later, still love it
customer_reviews.text: Replaced original screen that had rusted out with this one a year ago and absolutely love it. The high dome allows for a great fire, much better than our lower original screen. The ability to add wood by just lifting up half the screen without having to remove the whole screen is an excellent feature.
customer_reviews.author: TML

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, no missing hardware, packed well. Good build quality too. It's steel and its going to get super hot obviously, so I plan to spray it with high temp paint annually and bring it in for the winter, but those should be obvious if I want a thing like this to last. Overall Im very happy and wpuld buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler B

customer_reviews.title: Decent deal
customer_reviews.text: One handle broke off with the first use. It come apart every once in awhile. Husband put lock tight the last time so maybe that’s the fix. Still a good purchase. Able to burn bonfires without catching the forest on fire
customer_reviews.author: WWB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. I use it on top of a sewer manhole. I did modify the holes so it would fit a little better but how do you beat $40. First fire was a little too hot and a little part of the screen bent in. My fault for too big of a fire. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: LWalk

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to DIY firepit. Needed to keep the embers off 200 year old Log Cabin
customer_reviews.text: We thought we'd add a firepit to our 200 year old Log Cabin rental in Fredericksburg, TX. Needed something to protect the log cabin and it's allergies to embers. This was the perfect addition and protection we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Okerholm

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRICE
customer_reviews.text: IT IS A GOOD VALUE . I PUT A COAT OF HEAT RESISTANT BARBECUE PAINT ON IT FOR EXTRA RUST PROTECTION . ITEMS THAT ARE EXPOSED TO EXTREME HEAT HAVE A TENDENCY TO RUST FASTER IN MY EXPERIENCE. I WILL ALSO COVER THE WHOLE PIT WHEN NOT IN USE AND NO DANGER OF FIRE WITH A TARP JUST TO KEEP IT MORE WEATHER PROTECTED.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Dimensions are not accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 48 inch opening in my fire pit. The 50 inch screen when fully pulled down comes up about 4 inches too short, therefore I can't use it. I've got it right on the edge of my pit and still won't reach the opposite side. Wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: Cestwhat

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great screen for our firepit! It is so nice to have the ability to move one section back for adding wood without completely removing the screen. We love it and Happy Campers in our own backyard!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Too thin metal
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared for your screen to look my pictures after 1 year of periodic use. I expected the metal to distort from the heat, but not to separate ! Should use heavier mesh! Other than that is works great!
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey barnes

customer_reviews.title: As great as the great outdoors.... perfect for a $200 fire pot, to a $2000 show piece fire pit.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy one man assembly approximately 20 minutes. Looks terrific and so far after a half dozen uses, continues to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Retired In Baja

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together. I had my firepit for 10 yrs. It still looks good but the screen was burnt up. I got this one and it looks brand new again and is way higher. Easy to add more logs.
customer_reviews.author: Newark Ca

customer_reviews.title: Not 32 inches
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this and a fire ring advertised as 33 inches outside diameter. Both products linked to each other on Amazon page. I thought the 32 inch screen would fit with 1/2 inch to spare on each side. However the ring was slightly less than 33 inches and the screen diameter was a bit over 33 inches not as spec'ed.
customer_reviews.author: Traverse Bay Guy

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This product has completely rusted. The screen does not hold shape at all. Very poorly designed.
customer_reviews.author: Dubra Family

customer_reviews.title: My space ship fire pit is wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I like the apparent quality of the screen. Don't expect the wind will blow this one across the patio. I did, as others have suggested, spray it with heat resistant paint before assembling. Assembly was a little puzzling at first but not hard once I understood the concept.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett

customer_reviews.title: Dented
customer_reviews.text: Arrived all dented. But, I was able to fix most of them myself.
customer_reviews.author: Robert N.

customer_reviews.title: Very well constructed.  Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this so far. Haven't lit a fire yet, but assembly was very easy and the assembled cover is very sturdy. The sections open and close very smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: make sure that you have all nuts and bolts needed
customer_reviews.text: my 28" screen was easy to assemble but when assembled it did not "line up properly" and there were gaps in the top of the screen. sparks could still escape from top of the screen. Doesn't Amazon check out these products before putting them on Amazon's site? Also it needed a few more nuts and bolts that were not included. It is an OK screen but looks flimsy once assembled . I expected a little more durability for the $89+ that I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice screen
customer_reviews.text: perfect fit. seems well made. took others advice and spray painted it with a coat of heat resistant paint. I was pleased to find one. don't like to use my fire pit with out one. shopped around. price seemed reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Janeski

customer_reviews.title: Good screen, could be great
customer_reviews.text: Works well to cover my fire pit, the only downside was the mesh holes weren’t small enough to keep ash contained. Because of that I feel it’s slightly overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Nice Clearance
customer_reviews.text: This domes up higher than the screens that come with the fire pits, making it more attractive for because it clears a stack of small logs.
customer_reviews.author: lotsamice

customer_reviews.title: Great fire pit cover
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to cover the open fire put in the back. Easy to assemble and strong. Have added heat paint to the screen area after a few fires to keep from rusting.
customer_reviews.author: D.H.D.

customer_reviews.title: expected a little more for the price
customer_reviews.text: its already rusting and it only had it for less than 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: lofas

customer_reviews.title: Look for another brand
customer_reviews.text: Where heat was near screen has rusted and lost its strength, it was used once, the screen only on top when leaving the fire at nights end.
customer_reviews.author: Heath

customer_reviews.title: Hot Buy
customer_reviews.text: My firepit came with a very low spark screen. Combine that with a shallow pan and about all I could burn in it was a candle. Decided to upgrade to a 'big boy' screen. Very happy. Easy to assemble. Love the ability to slide it open, stoke the fire, and close it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kds4

customer_reviews.title: Not a true 50" all around.
customer_reviews.text: Overall its a good piece. Arrived pretty quick and had it assembled in about 10 minutes. After all said and done it's 50" hinge to hinge, and about 46" handle to handle. Kinda awkward for a 48" fire pit, but does the job. It seems like it will last. I did spray it with high temp black paint as others have suggested. We'll see how that goes.
customer_reviews.author: Shellback01

customer_reviews.title: Keeps wildlife out of the firepit
customer_reviews.text: I needed this in order to keep wildlife from trying to get into the firepit between uses. We only have to keep out stray cats and birds, so it's been fine for that. It wouldn't do any good against bears though. The screen is not as fine as I thought it would be, so embers can fly out if it's too windy. But, the open and close aspect is awesome and works they way I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Kati Hiroto

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and well built.
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit leery when I ordered this because I was afraid it would not survive the shipping. All-in-all, it turned out great. The larger size was perfect for my fire pit and the price was certainly reasonable compared to a custom application.
customer_reviews.author: Rod S.

customer_reviews.title: Fire screen
customer_reviews.text: My town requires a spark screen as part of getting a permit for a fire pit. This works great and there was no issue getting permitted.
customer_reviews.author: W. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Not doing its job - does not stop ANY sparks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the purpose of safety - to stop sparks and embers from leaving the firepit area. While it would stop embers from jumping out, this fire screen has mesh so large that is does not stop ANY spark flying out. It has 3-mesh size (3x3 openings per inch) which is way too large for typical firepit use. Sparks just fly right through! Returning it back.....
customer_reviews.author: Vadim F.

customer_reviews.title: Great upon initial view
customer_reviews.text: Upon arrival easy to put together and very sturdy. Large and exactly what we needed - will post later after we have a fire - but not for a while its blazing temp here now
customer_reviews.author: Trixie

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: Really nice product. The screen it replaced was solid so I had to remove screen to mess with fire. Also sits up higher so heat shouldn't wear out screen as fast.
customer_reviews.author: M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great screen
customer_reviews.text: So far very pleased. Out in the weather! Will be interesting to see if it survives the winter weather in the mountains of Idaho.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Fits good on bricks from firepit kits.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this screen for our firepit we built about 4 years ago from one of the kits. It fits larger than the ring, which I like, but with the size of the bricks. Easy to open and close.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size. Drawback, missing poker/tool to lift the screen with
customer_reviews.text: So while I love this screen and it was easy to assemble and fits our outdoor fire pit perfectly, it didn’t come with a poker/tool to use to lift the lid back and forth which would be necessary since this thing will get very hot. I’ve tried to call and email the company and have heard nothing back. I’d like it if they could send us the missing poker/tool. That’s the only thing disappointed me about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. O

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and is sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and fits perfectly with the fire pit ring that was purchased. sturdy and easy to use. It was a little ackward to assemble but nothing out of the realm of what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Parra

customer_reviews.title: Although the screen came promptly and was easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Although the screen came promptly and was easy to put together, it does not hold up to use. I received it on Friday, used it on Saturday. Today (Tuesday) I went out to look at it. The frame was rusting already and the screen itself was caved in after only one use. I have requested to return it for a refund. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Evaul

customer_reviews.title: ehhh
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size...but when I used it over a fire pit to keep the ashes from blowing away...the fire caused it to buckle and now its very hard to open and close cause the shape is off. Should have been a thicker metal. Its a FIRE screen, it should take fire.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect outdoor fireplace cover
customer_reviews.text: No more flying fire debris!!! Should have purchased this years ago. Nice quality and I love the way it slides up making it easy to add more firewood. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Khloe

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, should have read all the reviews. The product is definitely flimsy, definitely overpriced for the quality level.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F.

customer_reviews.title: Fire pit fire dome
customer_reviews.text: Change to rust very easily only last about a year-and-a-half and it has to be replaced, great idea I wish it was more durable.
customer_reviews.author: TROB

customer_reviews.title: happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: It has plenty of height to keep it above the flame, although my husband still managed to get a tall raging fire going and so part of the screen is warped slightly. But it hasn't affected the function. It also tends to move side to side too much, but that's probably because of the design of the base. Overall, happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: klebsbff

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, feels like good quality. Not used yet, but fits the fire pit as expected.
customer_reviews.author: King

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today, and assembly was a little confusing at first, but I got it. Sturdy build, not very heavy, and easy to open. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Barry Wright
